meanings.definition: Able to be easily carried or moved.
meanings.sent1: The small backpack was very portable for the little girl.
meanings.sent2: The suitcase was light and portable, making it perfect for travel.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the portable chair to the picnic made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as portable as a ray of sunshine, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The portable fan provided much-needed relief on the hot summer day.

meanings.definition: A small transportable building used as a classroom or office.
meanings.sent1: The school set up a portable classroom to accommodate the growing number of students.
meanings.sent2: The office had a portable cabin for employees to use during construction.
meanings.sent3: The portable office looked like a tiny house on wheels, amusing everyone who saw it.
meanings.sent4: The portable classroom was a beacon of learning in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent5: The portable building served as a temporary shelter during the storm.

meanings.definition: A piece of software that can be run on different types of computers.
meanings.sent1: The new portable software allowed users to access it from any device.
meanings.sent2: The portable application was compatible with both Mac and Windows computers.
meanings.sent3: The portable program danced across the screen, entertaining the users.
meanings.sent4: The portable software was a chameleon, adapting to any computer system.
meanings.sent5: The portable app transformed the way people worked on their computers.
